title: Synthetic Recap
body:
MINNEAPOLIS (AP) — In the annals of basketball, there are nights that belong not to teams, but to one man. Thursday evening at the Target Center was Kevin Garnett’s night.

The 21-year-old phenom delivered a performance for the ages, pouring in a career-high 47 points to single-handedly will the Minnesota Timberwolves to a breathtaking 108-105 victory over the Phoenix Suns. In a game featuring other stars, Garnett’s brilliance rendered them all supporting actors in his historic showcase.

From the opening tip, it was clear Garnett was operating on a different plane. He was unstoppable, a whirlwind of silky jumpers, powerful drives, and relentless effort on both ends of the floor. His final line was a masterpiece: 47 points on 20-for-29 shooting, 14 rebounds, and 3 assists. Every time the Suns threatened to pull away or close the gap, Garnett answered with another clutch basket, his intensity fueling the raucous home crowd.

Phoenix, led by a stellar 35-point effort from Kevin Johnson and 23 from Wesley Person, fought valiantly. But they had no answer for the young Timberwolf. Garnett’s dominance inside negated Tom Gugliotta’s 19 points and 13 rebounds, turning a potential duel into a solo recital.

The game hung in the balance until the final seconds, but the outcome was inevitable. This was Garnett’s moment, a career-defining explosion that announced his arrival as one of the league’s most unstoppable forces. On this night, the scoreboard told the final tally, but the story was written in one name, and one name alone: Kevin Garnett.
